content: amigurumi pumpkin finished size about 1 tall by 2-1/2 wide w/o stem materials pumpkin body - worsted in orange stem small amount of worsted in green or brown stuffing crochet hook in size f or one size down from the suggested hook size on the yarn label yarn needle round 1 use magic loop single_crochet 6 times into ring 6 sts draw loop tight do not join rounds place st marker in last stitch to mark end of round round 2 2 single_crochet in each stitch 12 sts round 3 single_crochet in next stitch 2 single_crochet in next st around 18sts round 4 single_crochet in next 2 sts 2 single_crochet in next st around 24sts round 5 single_crochet in next 3 sts 2 single_crochet in next st around 30 sts rnds 6-10 single_crochet in each st around 30 sts optional for a taller pumpkin repeat rnds 6-10 again round 11 single_crochet in next 3 sts decrease 1 st in next 2sts around 24 sts round 12 single_crochet in next 2 sts decrease 1 st in next 2sts around 18 sts start adding stuffing while you still have room round 13 single_crochet in next st decrease 1 in next 2sts around 12 sts round 14 decrease in next 2 sts around 6 sts this will be the bottom of the pumpkin fasten_off but leave about a yard-long tail thread tail onto needle take some stitches to draw hole closed then stitch through the hole in the center of the pumpkin and out the hole for beginning ring bring it around the outside of the pumpkin and take another stitch through the center continue until you have created 5-6 ribs fasten off trim end stem leaving about an 8 inch tail chain 7 single_crochet in each st fasten_off leaving about an 8 inch tail using your needle stitch each tail through the center and tie them together at the bottom trim end to get the stem to stand up nicely you can spray it with hairspray
